item.title: Feds ask Waymo about robotaxis repeatedly passing school buses in Austin
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The agency already opened an investigation in October over Waymo's performance around school buses. Waymo said it issued a software update to its fleet to improve performance.

item.title: Micro1, a Scale AI competitor, touts crossing $100M ARR
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Micro1 started the year with roughly $7 million ARR. Now, it claims to have surpassed $100 million in ARR, double what it reported in September.

item.title: Apple’s executive shake-up continues with departures of general counsel and policy head
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple loses two more top senior executives with exits of longtime general counsel Kate Adams and environmental VP Lisa Jackson. Meta’s Jennifer Newstead is set to join as new general counsel in 2026.

item.title: Anthropic CEO weighs in on AI bubble talk and risk-taking among competitors
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Anthropic's CEO shared his thoughts on the economics of AI and the risk-taking of competitors, saying some were "YOLO-ing" with regard to spending.

item.title: Musk says new Tesla software allows texting and driving, which is illegal in most states
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Texting while driving is banned in nearly every state, even with the use of advanced driver-assistance systems like Tesla's Full Self-Driving (Supervised) software.

item.title: From the NFL to Startup Battlefield: How Alltroo built a brand that wins
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: On season one of Build Mode: Product, Meet Market, we explore what it really takes to get your product into the hands of customers.

item.title: Celebrity Co-Founders Not Required: Building Influence from Scratch
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Alltroo co-founders Kyle Rudolph and Jon Walburg share how they transformed their pro-athlete star power into a fundraising platform that allows their community the ability to donate to a variety of organization and win high-value prizes. In this episode of Build Mode, they reveal how they leveraged their networks to disrupt the charitable giving industry, […]

item.title: Legal AI startup Harvey confirms $8B valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Harvey confirms a third enormous round of funding in 2025 that has skyrocketed its valuation. Again.

item.title: Sanctioned spyware maker Intellexa had direct access to government espionage victims, researchers say
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Based on a leaked video, security researchers alleged that Intellexa staffers have remote live access to their customers' surveillance systems, allowing them to see hacking targets’ personal data.

item.title: Amazon’s new Kindle Scribe and Kindle Scribe Colorsoft launch on December 10
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The new Kindle Scribe has a larger 11-inch glare-free display, is just 5.4 mm thick, and weighs only 400 g. It’s also 40% faster when writing or turning pages.

item.title: California’s ban on self-driving trucks could soon be over
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Revised rules in California would allow self-driving trucks to test on public highways. The rules also close a loophole allowing police to issue tickets for driverless vehicles.

item.title: Why Day One Ventures’ Masha Bucher thinks VCs and storytelling go hand-in-hand
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Day One Ventures' Masha Bucher doesn't just invest in startups — she also tells their stories. Her integrated model aligns incentives and proves conviction matters more than contracts.

item.title: Meta centralizes Facebook and Instagram support, tests AI support assistant
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The new support hub will connect users to security tools, account recovery options, and an AI assistant.

item.title: Amazon reportedly considering dropping USPS and building a competing postal service
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Amazon is the USPS' biggest customer, and the e-commerce giant's potential break from the postal agency comes as the two sides are negotiating a new deal.

item.title: TikTok rolls out a ‘Nearby Feed’ to display local content in select countries
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: While TikTok is already known for its recommendation algorithm, which is able to target users with highly personalized content, the addition of a Nearby Feed gives it the ability to display even more relevant content to its users.

item.title: Meta reportedly plans to slash Metaverse budget by up to 30%
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The proposal reflects the overall lack of interest in products like Meta's social virtual reality platform, Horizon Worlds.

item.title: Spotify says Wrapped 2025 is its biggest yet, with 200M+ users in its first day
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: After last year's flop, Spotify Wrapped engagement is up 19% and shares were up 41%, the company says.

item.title: Anthropic signs $200M deal to bring its LLMs to Snowflake’s customers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AI research lab Anthropic inked a $200 million deal with Snowflake to bring its AI models to Snowflake's 12,600 customers.

item.title: EU investigating Meta over policy change that bans rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The European Commission is launching an antitrust investigation into Meta's move to ban other AI companies from using WhatsApp's business tools to offer their own AI chatbots to users.

item.title: AI finds its way into Apple’s top apps of the year
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Although Apple has continued to avoid naming a dedicated AI app or AI chatbot as its app of the year, AI was showcased among this year's winners.
